info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 1 at 5:45PM MDT until April 1 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico... Northwestern Hudspeth County in western Texas... El Paso County in western Texas...
* Until 645 PM MDT.
* At 544 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over El Paso and the Lower Valley.
HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong winds up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 9 and 54. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 39.
Locations impacted include... Cornudas Mountains, Tornillo, Homestead Meadows, Orogrande, Agua Dulce, Biggs Field, Dairyland, Indian Cliffs Ranch, Chaparral, East El Paso, Loma Linda, Franklin Mountains State Park, West El Paso, Fabens, Fort Bliss, Clint, Butterfield, Mission Valley, Hueco Mountain Estates, and Sparks.
info.instruction: Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 6:45 PM MDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 6:45 PM MDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

area.areaDesc: Otero, NM; El Paso, TX; Hudspeth, TX

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 6:45 PM MDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 6:45 PM MDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.

area.areaDesc: Otero, NM; El Paso, TX; Hudspeth, TX
